question: 帆走
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>sail</kanji> <kanji>run</kanji>s boats along the sea by <vocabulary>sailing</vocabulary>! You can't run along the water unless the sail is out and catching the wind.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
